top_comment.text:
The crew hits the crazy market in Ambon for a little provisioning, gets 
some grey-market diesel, and prepares to set sail for Raja Ampat!

Karin's video debut! Check it out :)﻿
top_comment.author: SV Delos Crew

comments.text:
Looking good! Also confirm about fuel. A number of boats who fueled up in 
Indonesia before going to Singapore had fuel that was apparently mixed with 
something else. Had to dispose of the lot. BTW, of to Mauritius to morrow. 
Land of the BIG waves. Keep your fingers crossed for us. Sv Solace. Paul 
and Gina
comments.author: Paul Rae

comments.text:
You just got your self a new subscriber. love your video's :) and did it 
say you were from Seattle. That's where i' m from.
comments.author: Jacob Sonnen

comments.text:
Careful using grey market fuel. It is often off-spec as it is often normal 
fuel mixed with waste fuel, lubricants and other unknown oils which will 
often wear out your engine faster, cause failures or just be less 
efficient. After all, think about how it can usually be so much cheaper 
than normal fuel sources. I used to be a marine fuel oil trader, and grey 
market is usually very risky.

top_comment.text: How did you afford a 2000 super malamu???﻿
top_comment.author: Quarkwano

comments.text:
+Brian SV Delos
Thanks mate.. I've watched most of your vids by now, and just read the "How 
do we afford to sail post" and a couple other posts on your blog.. It's 
really an eye opening read, and basically you're living my dream.! I'm 
studying computer science myself, and I've been sailing since I was a kid, 
and I've always wanted to live the cruising life. So when I'm done, I'll 
hopefully be able to freelance from my own boat, and cruise in your wake.. 
Greetings from Denmark
comments.author: Quarkwano

comments.text:
+Quarkwano It's a long and winding story my friend!  We did write a few 
blogs posts about it.  If you head to http://www.svdelos.com and browse the 
right hand column you'll see "Popular Posts".  Check out the ones about how 
we afford to sail.  There are two of them and it's all in there! Fair Winds 
and thanks for watching!Brian SV Delos
comments.author: SV Delos Crew

captions.text:
"We're now in the city of
Ambon! The Capital of The Spice
Islands.

Filled with colour, horns and
delicious street food.

After our stay in sleepy Banda
the streets of Ambon were
insane.

It was like being thrown into a
blender with 300,000 other
people

all trying to go somewhere at
the same time.

"So today has been a very
eventful day!..

we got our checkout papers
sorted from the Harbour Master

and our crew guide Abba has
been taking us around, and we
just got to the market

Where we'll buy some fresh
product for our trip to Raja
Ambat

and we should be leaving
sometime tomorrow..
Very hot here! Sweating!

Not to mention the Spicy Bok So
I had earlier"

"The street in Ambon is really
good, but very spicy"

"But we got a coke and
delicious meal for about $1.50

HOT!"
"Hot one!"
"But it's good"

So we were off into the wilds
of the Ambon street markets.
Our mission -

stock Delos with enough fresh
fruits and veggies to last
about 3 weeks.

The market was really intense
but well stocked.

The only problem- dozens of
different vendors all selling
the same thing!
Our game plan was simple

send Abba in first to get the
price.

Once the price was set we'd
wander up and settle the score.

That was really the only way to
avoid the "foreigner price"
which could be double what a
local would pay.

"NEVER have we seen bigger
banana's than we have in Ambon!
Reminds me a lot of myself!"

As the day went on we got brave
and even bargained a few deals
ourselves.

"50c we just bought a coconut!
Back in New Zealand this is
like..
$5.00 for this stuff!"

"Yeah!"
"Mm so good!"

"Fresh fish of Ambon.. caught
right at the back door"
"The smell.. is very pungent"

Refrigeration and ice just
doesn't exist here.

Imagine years and years of
juices

combined under the tropical sun
to produce a new kind

of aroma that you didn't think
was possible.

No meat or fish for us please,
just the veggies!
"Misson accomplished!"

"Omg, we just everything that
is going to last us three weeks!
We got eggplant, eggs,

crazy water spinach"
"carrots..
"The best thing.. Ketjap Manis!"
"KETJAP MANIS!"
"AND we scored .. A NEW WOK!"

These little mini-buses are
pretty cool. If there's room,
you can just hop on

and hope that it takes you in
the right direction.

They're cheaper than taxi's and
it's never a dull ride!
"Hello!"

(horns honking) 
"Hey Mister!"
(laughing)

"Oh hello!" 
(laughing)

"So we just went to the market
in Ambon..
and...

..the fruit and vegetables have
lots of bugs, and nasties, and
dirt and everything
so it's a pretty big process..

we have to.. from the market,
we have to put everything in
the dingy..
come back to the boat, unload..

and then we pretty much shove
em all in a big bucket with
water

and a tiny bit of bleach just
to kill all the bugs and
everything

and then give them a fresh
water rinse

and then try and store them so
we use as much efficient

"goin on a fuel run! Getting
some diesel and then hopefully

some benzine for the ol dingy
here..
we're at the petrol station..

which is a bit sketchy, but
diesel's cheap!
Looks good!"

"Gotta go through some alley
ways here..

to get you the back room of the diesel!"
(laughs)
"Hello"
"water very bad for the boat"
"It's ok?"
"Hello"

Since the bombing in Bali a few
years ago

it's now illegal to carry
diesel in plastic jugs.

But, since we can't take Delos
to the petrol station on land,

we were forced to buy diesel on
the grey market.

We're sure some of the 20%
mark-up goes to pay off the
police that are on the dock
next door.

It's still cheap though at
about .65 cents per liter

less than ½ the pump price we
paid in Australia.
"Hello Mister!"

"Trying to work our arms here..
and our back"

"Can you hand me the other blue
one over there?"
"Sh *t!"
"I'm doing important things!"

"I also.. have the ring of fire"
"The ring of fire!"

"Like crazy. Crazy busy. To
busy..
Time to get some quiet.."

"What an amazing time in Ambon.
Friendly people, beautiful
markets..

But it's time to move on.
Heading to Raja Ambat"

Up Next!
Delos finally arrived in Raja
Ambat!
Does some awesome diving!
And party with the locals!

"Our lively filled with fresh
fruit and vegetables!"

"Look at where we are. Fresh
fruit and vegetable for all!"

"Welcome to the Ambon Markets!
Lets go get something to eat!"

"We are at the Ambon Markets.
This is it"
